home.title: Welcome to Fung.es
home.subtitle: Your AI-powered foraging companion
home.description: Discover, identify, and learn about wild edibles with the help of artificial intelligence

map.title: Interactive Foraging Map
map.description: Explore foraging locations and real-time data

species.title: Species Database
species.description: Explore our comprehensive database of edible species

chanterelle.name: Chanterelle
chanterelle.description: A golden-yellow mushroom with a distinctive funnel shape and fruity aroma
chanterelle.howTo: Look for them in deciduous forests, especially near oak and beech trees

porcini.name: Porcini
porcini.description: Also known as King Bolete, this prized mushroom has a brown cap and white to yellow pores
porcini.howTo: Found in coniferous and deciduous forests, often near pine trees

morel.name: Morel
morel.description: A distinctive honeycomb-capped mushroom that appears in spring
morel.howTo: Look in disturbed areas, burned forests, and near dead trees in spring

blackberry.name: Blackberry
blackberry.description: Sweet, dark purple berries that grow on thorny bushes
blackberry.howTo: Found in hedgerows, woodland edges, and disturbed areas in late summer

elderberry.name: Elderberry
elderberry.description: Small, dark purple berries that grow in clusters on elder trees
elderberry.howTo: Look for elder trees in hedgerows and woodland edges in autumn

nettle.name: Stinging Nettle
nettle.description: A nutritious green plant with stinging hairs that must be cooked
nettle.howTo: Found in disturbed areas, hedgerows, and woodland edges in spring and summer

dandelion.name: Dandelion
dandelion.description: A common weed with bright yellow flowers and edible leaves
dandelion.howTo: Found in lawns, meadows, and disturbed areas throughout the growing season

hazelnut.name: Hazelnut
hazelnut.description: Sweet, round nuts that grow on hazel trees
hazelnut.howTo: Look for hazel trees in hedgerows and woodland edges in autumn

wildGarlic.name: Wild Garlic
wildGarlic.description: A pungent herb with broad leaves and white flowers
wildGarlic.howTo: Found in deciduous woodlands in spring, often forming large patches

chickenOfTheWoods.name: Chicken of the Woods
chickenOfTheWoods.description: A bright orange-yellow bracket fungus that grows on trees
chickenOfTheWoods.howTo: Look for it growing on dead or dying trees, especially oak

identification.title: AI Mushroom Identification
identification.description: Upload a photo or use your camera to identify mushrooms and other edible species using our advanced AI models
identification.safetyWarning: This AI identification is for educational purposes only. Always consult with an expert mycologist before consuming any wild mushrooms. Never rely solely on digital identification tools for safety.

recipes.title: Recipe Collection
recipes.description: Discover delicious recipes using foraged ingredients

support.title: Support Fung.es
support.subtitle: Help us keep this project alive
support.description: If you find Fung.es useful, please consider supporting us. Your contribution helps us maintain and improve the service.

koFi.name: Ko-fi
koFi.description: Buy us a coffee on Ko-fi

footer.madeWith: Made with ❤️ for the foraging community
footer.disclaimer: Always verify identification before consuming any wild edibles
